member.summary: Returns a reference to the which is writing the grid into the destination.
member.remarks: The WordDocumentWriter can be used to export additional data to the Word Document before the grid table. It can also be used to add content to the headers and footers of the document. See the method for more details on headers and footers.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.WordWriterInitializeRowEventArgs
member.summary: Event parameters used for the event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.WordWriterInitializeRowEventArgs.Row
member.summary: The grid row being initialized.

remarks.para: This row is not the same as the row in the On-screen grid. It is a new row that belongs to the export layout. As such, properties of the row can safely be modified and will affect the export, but will not affect the on-screen grid.

Note: The Value property of a cell is not stored by the row. It is stored by the underlying data source. So setting the Value of a cell in this row will affect the same data source as the on-screen grid.

Note: Since this row is part of the export layout, it will not share state information (such as the selected or expanded state) with the on-screen row. To get a reference to the corresponding on-screen grid row, use the method of the grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.WordWriterInitializeRowEventArgs.SkipRow
member.summary: Specifies whether to skip the current row.

member.summary: Specifies whether to skip the descendats of the current row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.WordWriterInitializeRowEventArgs.SkipSiblings
member.summary: Specifies whether to skip sibling rows of the current row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.WordWriterInitializeRowEventArgs.TerminateExport
member.summary: Specifies whether to terminate the export process. If the export is terminated, the current row will not be processed.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.ExportAsync(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGrid,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Word document with the specified file name and exports the specified UltraWinGrid into it.
member.param: Grid to export.
Name and path of resulting word file.

remarks.para: The ExportAsync method exports the UltraWinGrid to Word asynchronously, unlike the Export method which is synchronous. This is acheived using timers and is not a multi-threaded operation. You should not attempt to access the exporter Workbook, Worksheet, or file until the operation export is complete. You can determine when the process has ending by trapping the event. During the asynchronous export process, the UltraWinGrid will disable the user's ability to add, remove, delete, edit, filter, sort, or otherwise modify the state of the data during the export process. It is strongly advised that you make sure that the grid's DataSource is not modified during the asynchronous export process. If the data is modifed during the asynchonous export process, the modified data may or may not be exported in it's new state, or (more likely) the export process may be terminated entirely. Also note that you may not perform more than one export operation at a time on the same UltraWinGrid or using the same UltraGridWordWriter, either synchronously or asynchronous. Attempting to do so will result in an .

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.ExportAsync(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.UltraGrid,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Exports the specified UltraWinGrid as a Word document into the specified stream.
member.param: Grid to export.
The stream into which the grid will be exported.

remarks.para: The ExportAsync method exports the UltraWinGrid to Word asynchronously, unlike the Export method which is synchronous. This is acheived using timers and is not a multi-threaded operation. You should not attempt to access the exporter Workbook, Worksheet, or file until the operation export is complete. You can determine when the process has ending by trapping the event. During the asynchronous export process, the UltraWinGrid will disable the user's ability to add, remove, delete, edit, filter, sort, or otherwise modify the state of the data during the export process. It is strongly advised that you make sure that the grid's DataSource is not modified during the asynchronous export process. If the data is modifed during the asynchonous export process, the modified data may or may not be exported in it's new state, or (more likely) the export process may be terminated entirely. Also note that you may not perform more than one export operation at a time on the same UltraWinGrid or using the same UltraGridWordWriter, either synchronously or asynchronous. Attempting to do so will result in an .

This is acheived using timers and is not a multi-threaded operation. You should not attempt to access the exporter Workbook, Worksheet, or file until the operation export is complete. You can determine when the process has ending by trapping the event. During the asynchronous export process, the UltraWinGrid will disable the user's ability to add, remove, delete, edit, filter, sort, or otherwise modify the state of the data during the export process. It is strongly advised that you make sure that the grid's DataSource is not modified during the asynchronous export process. If the data is modifed during the asynchonous export process, the modified data may or may not be exported in it's new state, or (more likely) the export process may be terminated entirely. Also note that you may not perform more than one export operation at a time on the same UltraWinGrid or using the same UltraGridWordWriter, either synchronously or asynchronous. Attempting to do so will result in an .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.AutoSize
member.summary: Returns or sets whether columns will be automatically sized to fit their contents before exporting.

remarks.para: Note: columns with set to True will not be autosized horizontally. This is to prevent columns for memo or other extremely large fields from becoming too wide. If you want to autosize a multiline column, you should do so in the event by calling the method on the column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.CheckBoxExportStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the style with which check box cells in the grid are exported to Excel.

remarks.para: By default, check box cells in the grid are exporting using an image of a simple (unthemed) checkbox.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.WordTableSettings
member.summary: Returns or sets properties that affect the Word Table into which the grid will be exported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.SubObjectPropChangeHandler
member.summary: Returns the event handler that notifies OnSubObjectPropChanged

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.ExportStarted
member.summary: Occurs before the export begins.

remarks.p: The is a cloned of the grid being exported. Since the layout is cloned, you can safely modify the layout for exporting without affecting the on-screen grid.
is the root of the grid being exported.

This event is fired before all other events when the method is called. You can use it to do any preprocessing before exporting process starts. For example, you can set properties on the cloned layout.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.InitializeRow
member.summary: Occurs when a row is initialized.

remarks.p: The argument returns the grid row which is being initialized. Note that this row exists in the cloned export layout, so any changes made to this row will affect the export without affecting the on-screen grid. This row may not have the same state information (such as the Selected or Expanded state) as the actual grid row in the on-screen grid. To get the on-screen row associated with this row, use the method.
The argument specifies whether to skip the current row. This argument doesn't affect exporting of descendant rows.
The argument specifies whether to skip the descendats of the current row.
The argument specifies whether to skip sibling rows of the current row.
The argument specifies whether to terminate the export process. Current row will not be processed.
This event is fired for every grid row which is being exported, and before is fired. Use this event to set grid row specific properties and to control exporting process.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.ExportEnding
member.summary: Occurs before the export process has ended, but before the Word document is finalized.

remarks.p: The argument is True if the exporting process was cancelled.

The ExportEnding event is invoked when the export process has completed to give the developer one final opportunity to manipulate the Word Document being generated. This is particularly important when using an overload of the Export method that takes a filename as the file will be saved after the ExportEnding is complete but before the so it will not be possible to make changes to the document after the ExportEnding event has fired. Also, since the file will not have been created until after the ExportEnding event fires, the file cannot be accessed until the ExportingEnded event.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.ExportEnded
member.summary: Occurs after the export process has completed.

remarks.p: The argument is True if the exporting process was cancelled.

The ExportEnded event is raised after the export process has been completed. If an overload of the Export method that accepts a filename was used, then the file would be available at this point since the file is saved after the event has been completed but before the ExportEnded.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.HeaderRowExporting
member.summary: Occurs before a header row is exported to a report.

remarks.p: returns the associated with the headers being exported.

This event is fired before a set of headers is exported to the report. The header includes the band header (if any), the group headers (if groups and levels are used), and the column headers. Use the Cancel argument to cancel the exporting of the entire set of headers.

Using these event arguments, it is possible to override the exporting of a header and provide custom exported data. Typically, this would be done by setting Cancel to True, and adding conent to the appropriate header container. If IsFixedHeader is True, content should be added to the FixedHeaderContainer, otherwise, content should be added to the HeaderContainer.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.RowExporting
member.summary: Occurs before a grid row is exported to a report.

remarks.p: The argument returns the grid row which is being exported. Note that this row exists in the cloned export layout, so any changes made to this row will affect the export without affecting the on-screen grid. This row may not have the same state information (such as the Selected or Expanded state) as the actual grid row in the on-screen grid. To get the on-screen row associated with this row, use the method.

This event is fired before each row is exported. This includes the row, it's cells, it's RowPreviewArea, and may also include column header if using RowLayout mode with column headers that are displayed with the cells. Use the Cancel argument to cancel the default exporting of this row.
This event fires only for normal data rows or GroupBy rows. It does not fire for header or summary rows. For header rows, use . For summary rows, use .

Using these event arguments, it is possible to override the exporting of a row and provide a custom export. Typically, this would be done by setting Cancel to True, adding a row to the reportTable, and then populating that row with the desired contents.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.SummaryRowExporting
member.summary: Occurs before summary row is exported to a report.

remarks.p: returns the being exported.
This event is fired before a summary row is exported to a report. A summary row includes the SummaryFooterCaption and all summary values. Use the Cancel argument to cancel row exporting.

Using these event arguments, it is possible to override the exporting of a summary row and provide a custom export. Typically, this would be done by setting Cancel to True, adding a row to the reportTable, and then populating that row with the desired contents.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.CellExporting
member.summary: Occurs before a grid cell is exported to a report.

remarks.p: returns the containing the cell.
returns the associated .
This event fires for data cells only. It will not fire for header or summary cells. For header cells, use . For summary cells, use .
Use the Cancel argument to cancel the exporting of a cell.

Using these event arguments, it is possible to override the exporting of a cell and provide a custom export. Typically, this would be done by setting Cancel to True, and then adding content to the ReportCell.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.HeaderCellExporting
member.summary: Occurs before a header cell is exported to a report.

remarks.p: returns the being exported.
indicates what type of header is being exported: a band header, group, or column header.
Use the argument to cancel the exporting of the header cell.

Using these event arguments, it is possible to override the exporting of a header cell and provide a custom export. Typically, this would be done by setting Cancel to True, and then adding content to the ColumnHeaderContainer, GroupHeaderContainer, or BandHeaderContainer (depending on the HeaderType).

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.UltraGridWordWriter.SummaryCellExporting
member.summary: Occurs before a summary cell is exported to a report.

remarks.p: returns the being exported.
returns the level of the Summary. Summaries are exporting into multiple rows (levels). The summary level indicates on which level this summary is displayed.
Use the argument to cancel the exporting of a summary cell.

Using these event arguments, it is possible to override the exporting of a summary cell and provide a custom export. Typically, this would be done by setting Cancel to True, and then adding content to the ReportCell.

member.summary: Converts pixels to points using the screen DPI.
member.param: An integer indicating a measurement in pixels.
Indicates whether the measurement is horizontal or vertical. This is neccessary to account for screen DPI.

member.summary: Converts points to pixels using the screen DPI.
member.param: A float indicating a measurement in points.
Indicates whether the measurement is horizontal or vertical. This is neccessary to account for screen DPI.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.Utilities.InchesToPoints(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts a length measured in inches into its corresponding measurement in points (a unit often used when printing).
member.param: A float indicating a measurement in inches.
member.returns: A float indicates the value in points.

remarks.p: This is typically used for printer calcuations where there are 72 points per inch.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.Utilities.PointsToInches(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts a length measured in points (a unit often used when printing) into its corresponding measurement in inches.
member.param: A float indicating a value in points.

remarks.p: This is typically used for printer calcuations where there are 72 points per inch.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.WordTableSettings
member.summary: Class which exposes properties to determine the look and behavior of the MS Word table into which the UltraWinGrid will be exported.

member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.summary: Returns True if the value is not the default.
member.returns: True if the value is not the default.

member.summary: Returns True if the value is not the default.

member.summary: Resets the property back to its default value.

member.summary: Determines whether any properties of the object differ from their default values.
member.returns: True if any property values differ from their default and the object should be serialized; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.WordTableSettings.Reset
member.summary: Resets the settings of the object to their default values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.WordTableSettings.Layout
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the layout algorithm that is used to determine the size and position of cells in the associated table.

remarks.p: By default, the table layout is Fixed, which means that the preferred widths of the table items are used to generate the final sizing of the table.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.WordTableSettings.PreferredWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the preferred width of the associated table, expressed as an explicit linear quantity.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the Layout property is set to 'Fixed'.

The PreferredWidth property provides a way to explicitly define the width of the associated table. The value is considered preferred because a consumer may elect to override this value based on the current table layout algorithm.
The unit of measurement used to express the property value is defined by the Unit property of the associated WordDocumentWriter.

The PreferredWidth property and the PreferredWidthAsPercentage properties are mutually exclusive, and the PreferredWidth property takes precedence, so in the case where both properties are explicitly set, the PreferredWidthAsPercentage property is not applicable.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinGrid.WordWriter.WordTableSettings.PreferredWidthAsPercentage
member.summary: Returns or sets the preferred width of the associated table, expressed as a percentage of the width of the containing element.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the Layout property is set to 'Fixed'.
This value is considered preferred because a consumer may elect to override this value based on the current table layout algorithm.
The valid range for this property's value is a number between .02 and 100. Note that the unit of measure is not defined by the associated document writer's unit of measure.

The PreferredWidthAsPercentage property and the PreferredWidth properties are mutually exclusive, and the PreferredWidth property takes precedence, so in the case where both properties are explicitly set, the PreferredWidth property takes precedence, and this property is not applicable.
